words.definition: If someone is adept at something, they are very good at doing it.
words.example: The carpenter is very adept at building houses.

words.definition: If land is barren, it has no plants growing on it.
words.example: People cannot farm in barren lands.

words.definition: If something is ceramic, it is made of baked clay.
words.example: The house’s roof was made of ceramic tiles.

words.definition: If something is culinary, it is related to cooking.
words.example: I gained culinary skills after working in a restaurant for many years.

words.definition: If something is dense, it has a lot of things close together.
words.example: The forest was so dense that it was hard to see through the trees.

words.definition: Dignity is the ability to be calm and serious and to be worthy of respect.
words.example: When the man lost his job, he maintained his dignity.

words.definition: To dominate means to control them or to be more important than them.
words.example: The loud man always dominates the conversation.

words.definition: If something is edible, you can eat it.
words.example: Not all berries are edible. Some are poisonous.

words.definition: If someone is hostile, they are angry and unfriendly.
words.example: The dog was very hostile and would bark at anyone who walked by.

words.definition: Your intake of food is the amount of food you take into your body.
words.example: To be healthy, you should decrease your intake of sugar.

words.definition: Likewise means in the same way or also.
words.example: I like the new teacher, and my classmates do likewise.

words.definition: Malnutrition is the state of not having enough of the right food to eat.
words.example: The children in the poor country suffered from malnutrition.

words.definition: Medication is medicine or drugs given to people who are sick.
words.example: The doctor gave me some medication for my cough.

words.definition: A misconception is a wrong idea about something.
words.example: It’s a common misconception that all snakes are dangerous.

words.definition: If something is obscure, it is not well known or is hard to see.
words.example: The meaning of the poem was obscure and difficult to understand.

words.definition: To oppress someone means to rule over them in a cruel and unfair way.
words.example: The king oppressed his people and took all of their money.

words.definition: To peel something means to remove its skin.
words.example: She peeled the apple before eating it.

words.definition: A prescription is a piece of paper on which a doctor writes the medicine you need.
words.example: The pharmacist gave me the medicine after I showed him my prescription.

words.definition: A respirator is a machine that helps a person breathe.
words.example: The patient was on a respirator to help him get enough oxygen.

words.definition: To strive means to make a great effort to do something.
words.example: She strives to be the best student in her class.
